class.name: anywheresoftware.b4a.objects.LineUtils
class.comment: Measure Height of TextView/Label with Multiline Text and varying line spacing

method.name: getMultilineHeight
method.comment:
Returns the required height in order to show the given text in a label with varying line spacing. This can be used to show dynamic text in a label. Note that the label must first be added to its parent and only then its height can be set. Based on code by Erel for StringUtils function MeasureMultilineTextHeight Usage: getMultiLineHeight( TextView as android.widget.TextView , Text as CharSequence, multiplier as float)
Example: Dim Label1 As Label Label1.Initialize("") Label1.Text = "this is a long sentence, and we need to " _ & "know the height required in order To show it completely." Label1.TextSize = 20 Activity.AddView(Label1, 10dip, 10dip, 200dip, 30dip) Dim LineS As LineUtils Label1.Height = LineS.getMultilineHeight(Label1, Label1.Text, 1.5)
